content.description: Great problem on quality stone. Climbs the right-most line on the boulder.
content.location: Starts with both hands in marginal slots/side-pulls and makes use of the gigantic start foot. Continues right through decent crimps and a difficult high-step to reach key crimps up high. Top out.

content.description: The west face of the Ozzy Boulder, visible from the approach trail. Good climbing on cool crystals and rounded crimps. A bit intimidating due to it's cryptic upper section and awkward fall potential.
content.location: Starts in a cool undercling feature and climbs the steep face using good crimps. Committing moves come at the top trying to latch the final rounded crimps.
Starting on Left, traverse right to finish on Right. Crux comes with the first few moves trying to unlock the sequence to get established on Right.

content.description: A tricky boulder problem that uses the small cracks, seams and pinches to ascend the obvious central line.
content.location: The obvious central line starts using left/right hands in the dual cracks about chest height. Use the good starting feet to get yourself established in the upper seam. Top out.

content.description: Great climbing on basalt knobs and crimps. Crux seems to be matching the large black crimp and trending out left over the face via small crimps.
content.location: Starting with a good left-handed basalt pinch and a good right-handed undercling and make the big move up to the large basalt crimp. Continue up and left via the cool chicken heads and crimps.

content.description:
The large, obvious boulder directly on the main trail, within view of the trailhead parking, about a 5 minute walk from the car. Several excellent problems exist from V1-V9.  

  If anyone knows the actual names, feel free to correct me.
